title: [$250] Fix localization: dates not being localized correctly

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem We've identified several places where we are not using our localization properly, leading to using formats that are not used in the selected locale. For example this is with spanish language: In spanish should be something like `19 ago, 2025 a las 12:02PM` or something like that. # Solution Remove any code that uses a hardcoded date format (not based on the locale) as long as the date is used to display information to users. Some examples (but please check if there are more places): - https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/e091028680e8e21729421dee3ec0547880042f59/src/libs/DateUtils.ts#L252-L255 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/0db6a75d619ac9d6280cf28ec0d2138f2b0ef8b5/src/CONST/index.ts#L432-L453 Replace all of then with the standardized [`dateStyle` and `timeStyle`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/DateTimeFormat/DateTimeFormat) (using one of the values "full", "long", "medium", and "short"), but let's inspect each case to make sure it makes sense to replace it and with which format exactly we want to replace it. Additionally, change [this](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/e091028680e8e21729421dee3ec0547880042f59/src/libs/DateUtils.ts#L112) to use `getWeekInfo().firstDay` of the current locale and ensure the calendar component works properly, showing the correct start day according to the locale (FYI 99% sure [this](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/e091028680e8e21729421dee3ec0547880042f59/src/libs/DateUtils.ts#L121) is wrong and 6 should be 7)

body:
If you havenâ€™t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.0-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-516/folder/13176675/41237191/864762782 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1695@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace with no expenses created in it yet. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Note that report preview shows the actual date as title. 5. Open the expense report. 6. Note that report header shows report number as title. 7. Return to chat. 8. Note that report title, now changed to the correct report number. ## Expected Result: When creating an expense on a workspace, report preview should display the correct report number as title. ## Actual Result: When creating an expense on a workspace, report preview shows the actual date as title, but when report is opened, title changes to the report number. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9fe4c382-1f95-4bc2-a1ee-fe6ea7bf2d95 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Bump react-native-reanimated to v4

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
Coming from this [proposal](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1756396579322159) ### Background react-native-reanimated is our core animation library. Weâ€™re currently on v3.19.1. v4 is essentially the continuation of v3: same implementation, but focused solely on the New Architecture and introducing new features. It also formalizes the split into two packages: react-native-reanimated and react-native-worklets. ### Problem Reanimated v3 is already effectively unsupported, no new features are added (only patch releases on request). Staying on v3 means we miss out on ongoing improvements, optimizations available only in v4, and risk falling behind as the ecosystem standardizes on v4. ### Solution Letâ€™s bump to Reanimated v4. This will: - Keep us current with the actively supported version and aligned with the ecosystem. - Enable new optimization options on Android ([issue with benchmark](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/pull/7823)) - Drop two patches (dontWhitelistTextProp.patch and correctly-handle-Easing.bezier.patch) - Allow us to remove the direct Reanimated dependency in react-native-live-markdown by switching it to react-native-worklets
